intro: Deutzia corymbosa var. dinggyensis, commonly known as the Dinggyen deutzia, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its clusters of fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its showy inflorescences and attractive autumn foliage.
